meanings.definition: A monetary unit of Mongolia, equal to one hundredth of a tugrik.
meanings.sent1: In Mongolia, you can buy small items with just a soum.
meanings.sent2: I exchanged my dollars for soum at the currency exchange.
meanings.sent3: The soum rolled away, causing a funny chase around the market.
meanings.sent4: Her savings were as scarce as a single soum in a vast desert.
meanings.sent5: The soum jingled in his pocket, a reminder of his travels.

meanings.definition: A traditional Mongolian unit of weight, approximately equal to 3.75 grams.
meanings.sent1: The jeweler measured the gemstone in soum to ensure accuracy.
meanings.sent2: She carried soum of meat to offer as a gift to the nomads.
meanings.sent3: The soum on the scale seemed to dance a little jig.
meanings.sent4: His love for her was as heavy as a bag of soum around his neck.
meanings.sent5: The soum balanced delicately on the tip of the scale.
